page.title: 15Churches in Haltwhistle
page.content: The Church of the Holy Cross stands just behind the Market Place. It is a very old church. We found out it was built over 700 years ago. In the church is a grave with a cross, a sword and the Blenkinsopp family coat of arms on it. The vicar lives in a large house near the church. There are 12 people in the choir and 4 servers to help each Sunday. A flower festival is held every September. At the east end of town there is the Roman Catholic Church of St. Wilfred. There is no resident priest. Services are taken by the priest from Haydon Bridge and the presbytery is now a private house. The usual congregation of about 60 is increased so much by summer visitors that the bishop gave special permission for the first Mass of Sunday to be held on Saturday night.
